image.altText: Two men standing with fruit vines in the background

props.synopsis: A 15-kilometre "suspension zone" was enacted in January after Queensland fruit fly maggots were found in homegrown peaches at Glynde, north-east of the Adelaide CBD. Two Adelaide Hills strawberry growers are calling for changes to national fruit fly protocols.

title.children: After fruit fly was found in the suburbs, growers can't sell in the hills

image.altText: A man in a plaid yellow shirt, glasses and face mask walks out of court being questioned by reporters.

props.synopsis: Former massage therapist Sumit Satish Rastogi, who has pleaded guilty to almost 100 sexual abuse offences against 40 women, has resorted to telling an Adelaide judge "I beg you" while asking for "one more day" on bail â€” but the request was knocked back on the basis it was "inappropriate" for him to remain in the community.

title.children: Massage therapist who sexually abused 40 women 'begs' to stay on bail

image.altText: Police officers look inside cardboard boxes outside a shed with a truck nearby

props.synopsis: Police say they have seized almost $800,000 worth of tobacco and $66,000 in cash after raiding 10 properties in the state's south-east.

title.children: One arrest after police seize tobacco and cash in SA raids

image.altText: A row of 12 guns resting diagonally on the front of a white car.

props.synopsis: A large amount of cash, guns and collectable coins have been recovered, and two men arrested in western New South Wales, following a violent break-in at a home in regional South Australia.

title.children: Huge haul of cash and guns recovered in NSW after SA home break-in, police say

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Brock Yandle, the brother of accused murderer Keith Yandle, told police he heard screaming and gunshots on the night Steven Murphy was killed in a shed at Kudla, a jury has heard.

title.children: 'He kept screaming': Jury told accused murderer's brother heard shooting

image.altText: An artist's projection of the Hydrostor facility near Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: An old mine in Broken Hill will be re-purposed by Canadian company Hydrostor as an "innovative" renewable energy storage and generation project tipped to create hundreds of local construction jobs.

title.children: Green light for nation's first underground compressed air energy plant

image.altText: Dorcy Rugamba looking up and to the side, standing with arms folded, slightly smiling.

props.synopsis: One of the stand-out shows at this year's Adelaide Festival is a devastating performance of love for family and for country. In it, audiences hear from a renowned Rwandan playwright who refused to let anger ruin him.

title.children: When Dorcy's family were killed, anger froze him. Telling his story helped

image.altText: Close-up of a person wearing a smart watch

props.synopsis: Flinders University researchers say young adults who use diet and fitness apps are more likely to obsess over diet than those who don't use them.

title.children: Fitness apps can lead to disordered eating and excessive exercise, study finds

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas wearing a navy suit sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government first held talks with insolvency firm KordaMentha about placing the Whyalla steelworks into administration on December 23, new documents reveal.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks administration talks began before Christmas

image.altText: Crime scene tape outsideÂ a home.

props.synopsis: South Australia's youth justice system was 'flooded' with almost 6,000 new cases last year, data obtained by the state's opposition shows, while the state's top cop is frustrated at the level of resourcing needed to tackle repeat young offenders.

title.children: Youth justice system 'flooded' in SA as top cop expresses frustration at repeat offenders

image.altText: A teenaged girl wearing a broad brimmed hat smiling and standing in front of a group of sheep.

props.synopsis: When the 19-year-old's phone fell from her ute tray while she was checking water troughs in far west New South Wales, it triggered a region-wide emergency response.

title.children: Smartphone mishap triggers big outback crash 'emergency'

image.altText: A woman with shoulder-length grey hair and glasses smiling in a paddock wearing a black wool jumper.

props.synopsis: A determined group of Kangaroo Island farmers has turned an unlikely dream into reality by opening a local wool mill in the wake of the Black Summer bushfires.

title.children: Wool mill born from disaster marks new chapter on SA island

image.altText: A profile photo of a man with apparent face art.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering his cellmate in an Adelaide prison has been declared mentally incompetent to commit the crime and found not guilty.Â

title.children: Man accused of cellmate murder found not guilty by reason of mental incompetence

image.altText: A fawn dingo looks on from behind a mesh fence in bushland

props.synopsis: Farmers are concerned after a bushfire revealed a dingo breeding site has been operating in Victoria's Little Desert National Park, but a conservationist says it poses no threat to livestock.Â

title.children: Farmers call for public meeting amid dingo breeding site discovery

image.altText: The front entrance of a hospital with a red-tiled roof and a driving bay and two flag poles out front.

props.synopsis: A locum doctor who walked out of a contract at Port Pirie Hospital after 45 minutes because it was "so understaffed that it was dangerous" has lost an appeal over her conduct. Dr Amira Mahboub saw just one patient before she left and failed to alert the appropriate managers she would not finish the contract.Â

title.children: Locum doctor left SA hospital, saying working there was 'too dangerous'

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young man cleaning a gun, cigarette in mouth

props.synopsis: More than 50 years ago, five young men from a small farming community fought in the Vietnam War. Now their stories have been written so people will know them more than "just a name on a plaque".

title.children: Vietnam vet has never worn his medals but his story is immortalised

image.altText: SA driver captured by mobile detection camera appeared to show them holding a burger and a mobile phone

props.synopsis: SA Police have released more images captured by mobile detection cameras showing drivers using phones, not having any hands on the wheel and not observing due care while driving.

title.children: Warning to distracted drivers after 17 lives lost on SA roads this year

image.altText: Former president Donald Trump is surrounded by army cadets while watching a football game.

props.synopsis: Experts say Australia matters less to Trump than it did to Biden which has consequences for vital intelligence-sharing alliance Five Eyes as well as the AUKUS deal.

title.children: Australia's perceived value to the US changes under Trump

image.altText: Proxy twins visit Queensland hospital

props.synopsis: Last year saw an increase in the number of organ donors, but as donors age and families refuse permission, fewer Australians are receiving life-saving donations.

title.children: Twin boys get life-saving organ transplants weeks apart

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: With land cheaper in the outer suburbs, families are opting to live in neighbourhoods that often lack basic health, education, retail and transport services. How long does it take for people to comfortably call these places home?Â

title.children: 'Urban sprawl is failing': Fighting the tyranny of distance in Australia's outer suburbs

image.altText: Trump shakes hands with French President Emmanuel Macron at the White House

props.synopsis: America's stunning turnaround comes as Donald Trump says he has been talking to Vladimir Putin about "major economic development transactions" between the US and Russia.

title.children: US sides with Russia in UN vote on Ukraine war

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Airservices Australia representatives tell a parliamentary hearing that almost 50 flights were forced to divert after China signalled it was conducting the hazardous drills in busy international airspace.

title.children: Virgin Airlines pilot first to alert authorities on Chinese live fire danger

image.altText: Unidentified woman receives a mammogram.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists said an aging population, alcohol consumption and low physical activity could all be contributing to the country's high breast cancer rate.

title.children: Australians record highest breast cancer diagnosis rate in the world

image.altText: man with tower in bakground

props.synopsis: Mobile voice and SMS connectivity would be extended across Australia under a Labor election pledge to update Australia's universal service obligation.

title.children: Labor pledges to expand voice and SMS coverage across Australia

image.altText: Two nuns bow their heads.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis was admitted to hospital in Rome on February 14 with breathing difficulties and his clinical picture has been described as "complex" and "critical".

title.children: Public prayers for Pope after 'slight improvement', prognosis 'not decided'

image.altText: Woman in red scarf and black hijab stands in a well decorated room with green walls, green and gold cushions, carpet, curtains.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says its soldiers fired into the home in a small village near the city of Jenin because they believed Palestinian militants were inside. Instead, the gunfire left a young mother covered in her only child's blood.

title.children: Mum says 'world should do something' as 2yo dies in Israeli strike

image.altText: Flood plume from Burdekin River captured on Feb 18 Courtesy Copernicus Sentinel 2

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery reveals huge amounts of floodwater heading into the ocean and towards parts of the Great Barrier Reef ahead of more potential severe weather.

title.children: Satellite photos show flood run-off flowing towards parts of Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: Jimmy Barnes thumbnail image

props.synopsis: Australian rocker Jimmy Barnes, who has been battling a series of health issues in recent years, says he wrote many of his new songs from a hospital bed.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes says he wrote many new songs while 'incapacitated' in hospital

image.altText: Woodside office with sign clearly showing, in Perth

props.synopsis: Australian shares lose ground after a mixed lead from Wall Street, while Woodside Energy reports a full-year profit up 115 per cent. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Woodside Energy more than doubles profit to $3.6b, ASX down

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: South Korea cuts interest rates by another 25 basis points
Domino's shares down 10 per cent on loss

image.altText: Sun rising over Mars taken from orbiting spacecraft.

props.synopsis: Strange, tilted geological formations spotted on Mars may be ancient beaches on the shore of a huge ocean, data from China's Zhurong roverÂ suggests.

title.children: 'Ocean on Mars' theory solidifies as rover detects 'hidden beaches'

image.altText: A sketch of an old bald man wearing thin glasses and a brown jacket

props.synopsis: Joel Le Scouarnec faces charges of aggravated rape and sexual assault against hundreds of victims, most of them children at the time of the alleged offence. WARNING: This story contains distressing details.

title.children: Ex-surgeon accused of assaulting 299 patients goes on trial in France

image.altText: A woman holds a pair of baby shoes behind her back

props.synopsis: Funding for the group, which supports people going through miscarriage, stillbirth and baby and child death, had been set to run out on June 30.Â

title.children: PM approves Red Nose funding that was rejected by 'some bureaucratic decision'

image.altText: Jack Ginnivan, Nick Watson and Connor Macdonald sit on the fence to celebrate with Hawks fans

props.synopsis: Hawthorn was one of the stories of 2024, winning admirers and driving opponents crazy in equal measure. Now in 2025, the Hawks have an oversized target on their backs.

title.children: The hunted and hated Hawks are ready to take on the world
